abstract: Energy Dept projects domestic crude oil production will continue to rise, though at slowed rate, despite plummeting prices on global market; projects average production of 9.3 million barrels a day in 2015, with average price of $58 per barrel throughout year.
lead_paragraph: The Energy Information Administration forecast oil production in the United States of 9.3 million barrels a day in 2015, up from last year, and rising to 9.5 million in 2016.

byline.contributor: Stanley Reed contributed reporting from London.

snippet: The Energy Information Administration forecast oil production in the United States of 9.3 million barrels a day in 2015, up from last year, and rising to 9.5 million in 2016.

keywords.value: Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Oil Output Seen Rising, Despite Fall in Its Price
headline.print_headline: Oil Output Seen Rising, Despite Fall in Its Price
